subject: Re: [junit] how to convert junit 3.8 testcases to junit 4
msgSnippet: Shubha, There s no tool I know of that does that directly.  Could you log a feature request at Sourceforge?
messageBody:
Shubha,

There's no tool I know of that does that directly. Could you log a
feature request at Sourceforge?
(http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=15278&atid=365278)

In the meantime, since JUnit 4 handles JUnit 3 test classes fairly
easily, I find that I can leave my old test classes in the JUnit 3
format, and only occasionally update a class by hand.

Do you have different requirements that make a wholesale move to JUnit
4 desirable? Thanks,

David Saff

On 3/28/07, Shubha B S <mailtoshubha@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> my intention is to convert junit 3.8 testcases to 4.
> I used testNG.JUnitConverter, but it could not solve my problem. It converts the testcases partially.
> Can anybody suggest?
>
> thanks
> Shubha
>
>
